    • Method Detail

      • isCFIAppAvailable

        public static boolean isCFIAppAvailable(@NonNull
                                        android.content.Context context)
        Checks if there is any Pay by Bank app enabled CFI App installed on the device.
        Parameters:
        context - The context to use.
        Returns:
        True if there is at least one PBBA enabled CFI App available, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        openBankingApp(Context, String)

      • openBankingApp

        public static void openBankingApp(@NonNull
                                  android.content.Context context,
                                  @NonNull
                                  java.lang.String secureToken)
        Open banking App for given context and secure token. Use this method if you do not use the Pay by Bank app Popup API (which takes care of the banking app opening).
        Parameters:
        context - The (activity or application) context to start the banking App.
        secureToken - The secure token of the payment for which the banking App is to be started.
        See Also:
        isCFIAppAvailable(Context), showPBBAPopup(FragmentActivity, String, String, PBBAPopupCallback), showPBBAErrorPopup(FragmentActivity, String, String, String, PBBAPopupCallback)

      • showPBBAPopup

        public static void showPBBAPopup(@NonNull
                                 android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity activity,
                                 @NonNull
                                 java.lang.String secureToken,
                                 @NonNull
                                 java.lang.String brn,
                                 @NonNull
                                 PBBAPopupCallback callback)
        Show the Pay by Bank app popup. It opens the CFI App automatically (without displaying the popup) if the device has CFI App installed and the user has tapped 'Open banking app' button.
        Parameters:
        activity - The activity to use.
        secureToken - The secure token for the payment.
        brn - The BRN code for the payment.
        callback - The callback listener for the popup. The popup keeps WeakReference to the callback.
        See Also:
        PBBAPopupCallback, showPBBAErrorPopup(FragmentActivity, String, String, String, PBBAPopupCallback), dismissPBBAPopup(FragmentActivity), setPBBAPopupCallback(FragmentActivity, PBBAPopupCallback)

      • showPBBAErrorPopup

        public static void showPBBAErrorPopup(@NonNull
                                      android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity activity,
                                      @Nullable
                                      java.lang.String errorCode,
                                      @Nullable
                                      java.lang.String errorTitle,
                                      @NonNull
                                      java.lang.String errorMessage,
                                      @NonNull
                                      PBBAPopupCallback callback)
        Show the Pay by Bank app Error Popup.
        Parameters:
        activity - The activity to use.
        errorCode - The error code to display (optional). The error code is appended to the error message in round brackets (e.g. if errorCode is "A12.3" then the message displayed will be "Network error (A12.3)")
        errorTitle - The error title to display (optional).
        errorMessage - The error message to display.
        callback - The callback listener for the popup. The popup keeps WeakReference to the callback.
        See Also:
        PBBAPopupCallback, showPBBAPopup(FragmentActivity, String, String, PBBAPopupCallback), dismissPBBAPopup(FragmentActivity), setPBBAPopupCallback(FragmentActivity, PBBAPopupCallback)

      • setPBBAPopupCallback

        public static boolean setPBBAPopupCallback(@NonNull
                                           android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity activity,
                                           @NonNull
                                           PBBAPopupCallback callback)
        Set the callback listener for the popup currently displayed (if any). Use this method to reconnect to the popup in case of orientation change. If there is no popup shown then this method has no effect. If the activity implements the PBBAPopupCallback interface then the popup automatically reconnects to the activity on attach. This method takes precedence over the automatic reconnecting, so if this method has been called with a valid callback listener before the popup is displayed then the callback interface given in this method will be applied on the popup and the callback interface implemented by the activity will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        activity - The activity to use.
        callback - The callback listener for the popup. The popup keeps WeakReference to the callback.
        Returns:
        True if the callback is set (the popup is displayed), false otherwise.
        See Also:
        showPBBAPopup(FragmentActivity, String, String, PBBAPopupCallback), showPBBAErrorPopup(FragmentActivity, String, String, String, PBBAPopupCallback)

      • dismissPBBAPopup

        public static boolean dismissPBBAPopup(@NonNull
                                       android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity activity)
        Dismiss the Pay by Bank app popup. This method does not have any effect if there is no PBBA popup displayed.
        Parameters:
        activity - The activity to use.
        Returns:
        True if the popup was dismissed, false if there was no popup displayed (so there was nothing to dismiss).
        See Also:
        showPBBAPopup(FragmentActivity, String, String, PBBAPopupCallback), showPBBAErrorPopup(FragmentActivity, String, String, String, PBBAPopupCallback)
